intro: Rogiera amoena, commonly known as the beautiful rogeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of pink and white. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil to flourish. Rogiera amoena is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
